summary.p: Bundle (composite manuscript) made of 6 items (each consisting in 1 palm-leaf folio) of various measurements. Most items are of Christian contents. With 3 notes on paper leaves, pertaining to some of the items.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (July 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.
Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and Cabaton (1912) describe only one folio of this 6-folio composite manuscript.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (July 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

support.p: Number of stringholes varying from one item to the other. One string with lead seal.

additions.desc:
Note in black ink on a detached paper sheet, pertaining to Indien 472a and Indien 472b and repeating the information contained in R.B. N° 4530bis (1847):
R.B. N° 4530bis. 1847.
2 passages du N. T. en Tamoul avec la tradn en Allemand.
St Jean XVI, 33
Ep. aux Rom. XII, 18

Note in black ink, by two different hands, on a detached paper sheet, pertaining to Indien 472c:
Feuille de palmier contenant un fragment d’ouvrage tamoul, remise au Dépt des Manuscrits par le Dépt des Estampes, le 11 août 1852. Hand #1
(C’est une feuille de l’histoire de St François Xavier.) Hand #2

Note in black pencil listing 5 items, on a detached paper sheet, pertaining to Indien 472d, as the item 5 in the list is the only one in Tamil and as the figure 5 is written (in black pencil?) on the left margin of the recto of Indien 472d:
1-3 = modèles d’écriture arabe.
4 un feuillet d’un ouvrage sanskrit écrit en caractères Devanagari (Table Géographique)
5 feuille de palmier langue et caractères tamoul

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF. The front one is (unusually) partly painted in black.

origin.origDate: The various items of this composite manuscript appear to have dates ranging approximatively from possibly 1700 to 1850.

acquisition.p: Indien 472a and Indien 472b were acquired by the BnF in 1847 from Schwaighauser, "Elève de l'école des chartes", along with other items. See R.B. N° 4530bis (1847).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
